metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14342 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
It was found that cifs-utils' mount.cifs was invoking a shell when requesting the Samba password, which could be used to inject arbitrary commands. An attacker able to invoke mount.cifs with special permission, such as via sudo rules, could use this flaw to escalate their privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-14342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cifs-utils - 2:6.11-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:6.11-0ubuntu1').
